shortdesc.ph: The information about the external encoded video frame.

plentry.pd: The codec type of the local video stream. See . The default value is (2).

The codec type of the video:
1: VP8
2: (Default) H264
5: VP9.
The width (pixel) of the video frame.
The height (pixel) of the video frame.

pd.p: The number of video frames per second.
When this parameter is not 0, you can use it to calculate the Unix timestamp of the external encoded video frames.

plentry.pd:
The video frame type.
0: (Default) , blank frame.
3: , keyframe.
4: , the Delta frame.
5: , the B frame
6: , unknown frame
The rotation information of the video frame, see .

The rotation information of the video frame, as the following:
0: (Default) 0 degree.
90: 90 degrees.
180: 80 degrees.
270: 270 degrees.
The track ID. Used in scenarios with multiple video tracks in the channel.
The Unix timestamp (ms) for rendering externally encoded video frames.
The Unix timestamp (ms) for rendering the external encoded video frames.
The user ID to push the the external encoded video frame.
The type of video streams. See .
